Article.ArticleTitle: Enhanced degradation and mineralization of 4-chloro-3-methyl phenol by Zn-CNTs/O<sub>3</sub> system.

AbstractText: A novel zinc-carbon nanotubes (Zn-CNTs) composite was prepared, characterized and used in O<sub>3</sub> system for the enhanced degradation and mineralization of chlorinated phenol. The Zn-CNTs was characterized by SEM, BET and XRD, and the degradation of 4-chloro-3-methyl phenol (CMP) in aqueous solution was investigated using Zn-CNTs/O<sub>3</sub> system. The experimental results showed that the rate constant of total organic carbon (TOC) removal was 0.29 min<sup>-1</sup>, much higher than that of only O<sub>3</sub> system (0.059 min<sup>-1</sup>) because Zn-CNTs/O<sub>2</sub> system could generate H<sub>2</sub>O<sub>2</sub> in situ, the concentration of H<sub>2</sub>O<sub>2</sub> could reach 156.14 mg/L within 60 min at pH 6.0. The high mineralization ratio of CMP by Zn-CNTs/O<sub>3</sub> occurred at wide pH range (3.0-9.0). The increase of Zn-CNTs dosage or gas flow rate contributed to the enhancement of CMP mineralization. The intermediates of CMP degradation were identified and the possible degradation pathway was tentatively proposed.
